title: WhiteCrypto
author: WhiteCrypto
content: Just found out an interesting  Bitcoin documentary film on YouTube. CZ Binance, Justin Sun Tron, Charles Hoskinson Cardano and many other top crypto projects founders & influencers discuss how blockchain changes the world. Do you think it is worth to be watching? Or we don’t have to trust centralized ecosystem founders to discuss Bitcoin? Here is the link: https://youtu.be/jP5W8PmyC1c

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: In as much as one is against centralized exchanges and organization that's does not mean those men behind those big projects don't have anything to offer to the crypto world.. I respect them alot, pulling a big project like is something that requires brain and calculation. They see vision beyond what most of us see in Bitcoin that's why they make a great move by creating their own project. We are all for same purpose (supporting crypto currency) but just on a different page.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: One thing for sure: Bitcoin and the things it is representing including decentralization and for me financial empowerment is HERE TO STAY and in the face of the great turmoil happening right now in the banking system, it is getting the limelight it all deserves. Now, crypto industry leaders know that eventually it is decentralization that we are fighting for. One day, decentralized platforms will be taking the lead especially in the threats posed by many encroaching governments as they want to exercise their control mechanism on all of us. This documentary is a very good one...educating people on many things so as we can appreciate Bitcoin and the revolution it started years ago. Indeed, our money should be working for us and not against us.

comments.author: tisnaislam111
comments.body: If we look at history. Then I can see. How people have changed since ancient times. How did people live then? And how is it now?The world where it is now will be better in the future. Will develop more.Nothing in the world can survive alone.Also this banking system can be lost. More modern technology will come from this.So what if the latter changes the world. Then blockchain will change the world.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: WhiteCrypto on March 19, 2023, 01:15:39 AMSnipThe only focus or context of the videos was on the importance of BTC and blockchain over people's custody of their assets. Like "we can fully control our assets etc. Well, I have a question for you, like I am from a developing country where a problem of load shedding exists. And sometimes there is no electricity even in the whole country but now the occurrence of this event increased in 2022 till now. So in a total blackout, there is no we can access our assets because to do that we need a battery in our devices like laptops and phones, and to perform transactions we need the internet. Overall, in that total blackout banks were also un functional so overall, I can say both sectors depend on electricity and internet communication. So I think we should not say that by adopting blockchain or BTC technology and decentralization we will be free, no. We just have to take care of our assets ourselves. And in the video, there was a question about whether BTC and blockchain could make lives more efficient than why other groups of people are opposing it. I think that's because of less employment there will be once the total sector of banking and finance shifts to blockchain and digital currency which will eliminate the need for workers. Well, that's only one factor on the list. It's up to you to trust the CEOs of exchanges or not, as far as BTC has come, it's been a great success for it and there is no doubt in it that BTC provides the poor side of society a chance to come forward and give a healthy life. Likewise my self I have no properties I am a student and started to earn via writing articles for bounties then things just started to streamline.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I haven't watched it, and I guess I probably won't. I will give them the benefit of the doubt but when it comes to unbiased views, these people are not the best out there. They're more of businessmen than visionaries, especially Zhao and Sun. I'm not even sure if these two are assets or liabilities to the crypto community. I don't know what they're preaching, but if it's the gospel of Bitcoin, they're certainly not practicing what they're preaching, not walking the talk. Andreas Antonopoulos is a world better than them.

Do you think it is worth to be watching? Or we don’t have to trust centralized ecosystem founders to discuss Bitcoin?Do you want to trust a man who wants to reorg/roll back bitcoin in order to save his own centralized exchange? Anyway, I didn't watch the video and probably won't try to see it as a whole at all. But if you truly want to grasp how blockchain gets utilized or generally about bitcoin digital economy and decentralization, there are way better resources compared to the three people who made centralized coins and "influencers" that on the video.A. Antonopoulos is a renowned person that talks about bitcoin since its early stage, you might want to take a look at his content. You can also see further various resources about bitcoin:  https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information.html, instead of a single documentary you put, there is various option that I am certain it is way more comprehensive.

comments.author: kelonmusk
comments.body: Personally, I think it's always worth staying informed and educated about new developments in the crypto space, so I think watching documentaries can be a good way to learn more.Nonetheless, it is important to remember that while the founders and influencers featured in the documentary may have valuable insight, they represent a centralized ecosystem.So, it is always important to approach any new information with a critical eye and consider various perspectives before making any conclusions.The future of BTC's decentralized and digital economy remains a little uncertain, but it is clear that blockchain technology is here to stay.I think it's up to all of us to continue to learn and explore this space, and to stay open to new ideas and developments.
